Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 200 words that follows your plan. 

Prehistory is the time before people wrote things down. A long, long time ago, people didn't know how to write yet. They didn't leave behind any papers or books with their stories and histories. But, they did leave behind clues that help us learn about them. These clues are things like tools, buildings, and artwork. We can use these clues to imagine what life was like for our ancestors.

We know that people lived in different places all over the world, and they made different kinds of tools to help them survive. Some people made sharp rocks to cut meat and plants, while others made big stones to build houses. We can even see pictures on the walls of caves and in the sand, which were made by people a long time ago. These pictures are like a big scrapbook of what life was like in prehistory. They tell us about how people lived, what they ate, and what they believed in.

By studying these clues, we can learn about our ancestors

Before people started writing, they didn't leave behind much to tell us about their lives. That's why we call this time in human history "prehistory." It's a word that means before history. It started when the first humans appeared on Earth, maybe around 6 million years ago. People during this time were mostly hunters and gatherers. They didn't have houses or cities like we do today. They lived in small groups and moved around to find food. We can learn about them by looking at the tools they made and the bones of the animals they hunted. We can also learn about them from the rocks and caves they left behind. These clues help us imagine what life might have been like for people a long, long time ago.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Early Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 200 words that follows your plan. Here is a possible paragraph: 
Long, long ago, before people had houses and cars and computers, people lived in the past. This is called prehistory. During this time, people were still learning how to take care of themselves and their families. They lived in small groups, like families, and found food to eat, like berries and fish. They made tools from rocks and sticks to help them hunt and gather. Some people lived in caves, while others built shelters from branches and leaves. They wore animal hides for clothes. People in prehistory also made art and decorations from stones and shells. They didn't write books or keep records like we do today. Instead, they told stories and passed them down from one generation to the next. Prehistory lasted until people started building cities and writing down their history. This is when the ancient civilizations, like Egypt and Greece, began. We can still learn about prehistory by looking at the things they left behind, like old tools and bones.

Prehistory is a big word that means the time before people wrote things down. A long, long time ago, people didn't have pens or paper, so they didn't leave behind any written messages. But they still left behind clues, like rocks, bones, and tools. These clues help us learn about the people who lived back then. We can look at the tools they made and the houses they built to figure out how they lived and what they did. We can even look at the food they ate and the clothes they wore. It's like solving a mystery! Archaeologists are like detectives who dig up the clues and try to put the puzzle together. They use what they find to make pictures of what life was like in the past. It's a fun job, and it helps us learn about our ancestors and where we come from. So, prehistory is like a big puzzle, and archaeologists are the ones who help us solve it.
